stance_2: I want to stop eating meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that caring about animals is the motivation for wanting to stop eating meat.

stance_1: I eat chicken and fish regularly
stance_2: I want to stop eating meat
justification: Eating chicken and fish regularly conflicts with the desire to stop eating meat.

stance_1: I eat chicken and fish regularly
stance_2: I try to eat more tofu
justification: Trying to eat more tofu as an alternative is in implicit tension with regularly eating chicken and fish.

stance_1: I try to eat more tofu
stance_2: I want to stop eating meat
justification: Trying to eat more tofu supports the desire to stop eating meat by seeking alternatives.

stance_1: I eat chicken and fish regularly
justification: The interviewee's regular meat consumption is supported by living in a family that eats meat regularly.

stance_1: Eating less meat is hard in this economy
stance_2: I want to stop eating meat
justification: The interviewee directly states that economic conditions make it hard to eat less meat, conflicting with the desire to stop eating meat.

stance_1: Eating less meat is hard in this economy
stance_2: I try to eat more tofu
justification: The economic difficulty of eating less meat makes it harder to regularly choose tofu over cheaper meats.
